body_html:
as of 14/4/2017 if you're downloading the cuDNN [Download cuDNN v6.0 (March 23, 2017), for CUDA 8.0]
pay attention that TF will still look for cudnn64_5.dll , while the cuDNN contains cudnn64_6.dll
I was able to fix this by simply renaming the file cudnn64_6.dll -> cudnn64_5.dll
body_text:
as of 14/4/2017 if you're downloading the cuDNN [Download cuDNN v6.0 (March 23, 2017), for CUDA 8.0]
pay attention that TF will still look for cudnn64_5.dll , while the cuDNN contains cudnn64_6.dll
I was able to fix this by simply renaming the file cudnn64_6.dll -> cudnn64_5.dll
body:
as of 14/4/2017 if you're downloading the cuDNN `[Download cuDNN v6.0 (March 23, 2017), for CUDA 8.0]`
pay attention that TF will still look for **cudnn64_5.dll** , while the cuDNN contains **cudnn64_6.dll**
I was able to fix this by simply renaming the file **cudnn64_6.dll** -> **cudnn64_5.dll**
